entry.title: I want to be me (is that not allowed?)
entry.summary:
Author: Tamystardust

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,700Chapters: 6/11Kudos: 395

Summary: “Buck?” Eddie called, worried. He was already half out of his chair when Buck came back to the kitchen.Panic all over his face, he looked between Chris and Eddie. “What’s going on?”“So… just so that we’re on the same page,” Buck whispered, trying to remain collected, but looking at Chris, “you didn’t call your grandparents, right?”“What? No!” Chris replied at the same volume, looking between Buck and Eddie with horror.“What-““Because they’re currently at our front door,” Buck finally said, still a whisper.

entry.title: IS IT OVER NOW?
entry.summary:
Author: Anna_Miguel

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 17,392Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 145

Summary: Post 7x10It Has been three months since everything went downhill. Three months since the Grant-Nash household burned to the ground, three months since Bobby decided it’s time for his retirement. Three months since Eddie fucked everything so much that his baby decide to walk away from him.>>>Chris is quite all the way down to the ice shop. He just talked to pick his ice cream flavor and said thanks after the man handed it to him. The rest of the time he is in his own mind. Until Sophia brings him back by grabbing his face for the jaw just like his dad does.“Earth to Christopher” she said. Chris looked at her and saw her eyes go softer. “Oh, mi amor, what’s wrong?“I heard them say they are looking for private teachers,” he said, his voice cracking . “They want me to move permanently”. Sophia just hugged him and let him cry. “I want to go home, with my dad and my Buck”

entry.title: i prayed that a ghost would haunt me (i hoped to hear you in its echo)
entry.summary:
Author: solarmoth

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,727Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 24

Summary: Eddie Diaz returns in the middle of a heatwave - right there, in touching distance, two paces away, like it's nothing. He’s leaning on the doorframe with his arms crossed over his chest, black tank top and blue watch and looking so very fondly down the hallway after his son. Something bright twists in Buck’s sternum. Eddie is straight. Buck’s not in love. He can't be. Everything he loves has ended up leaving.---Eddie Diaz realises he’s in love with Buck five weeks before showing up on his doorstep in the middle of a heatwave. Finally, finally, he allows himself to have.---Set around season 8b with some tim minear-style disregard for timelines.

entry.title: The Double Bind
entry.summary:
Author: Born_2_B_Gr8

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,305Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 159

Summary: When Evan was 18 years old, she learned that she had been sentenced to die since before she was born. On her 30th birthday, on the exact moment that she took her first breath, she would die a most horrible death. Overall she was okay with that as long as she managed to do two things before she died:1) Save her sister from her abusive marriage.2) Do the most good that she possibly could.Once both of those things happened she would be happy with what she had done with her life. Maybe in her next life she would have better luck. That was all she could ever hope for. The odds of her breaking her unbreakable curse would be to find true love, let alone multiple kinds of true love; impossible.Afterall, the universe had made it clear since before she had even been conceived that she was impossible to love.

entry.title: A Life From Another Sunset
entry.summary:
Author: glosspetras

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,111Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 13

Summary: Evan Buckley ran. Not out of cowardice, but because he no longer knew how to stay. The betrayal, the fear, the helplessness — on that stormy night, with his young daughter in the back seat, he wasn’t seeking an end. He just needed a pause. But the accident cut off more than his escape. Buck fell into a coma. Three years passed.When Buck finally wakes, the world is no longer the same. His body has changed. His home is different. His family, fractured. And Eddie... is about to get married. Buck’s return is another earthquake. But this time, he must relearn everything: how to speak, how to walk, how to feel, how to belong. Between the pain of what he lost and the uncertainty of what might still be rebuilt, he and Eddie are forced to confront what was left unresolved — and what may have never truly disappeared.

entry.title: This Place Could Be Beautiful, Right? You Could Make This Place Beautiful.
entry.summary:
Author: Mariereads167

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 101,484Chapters: 8/10Kudos: 48

Summary: Life is no longer the same for Eddie and Buck. The last seven years of comfort and familiarity are threatened to be washed away and in its place now is a physical seperation by hundred of miles.But alas, they trudge on.Buck learns how to love himself amidst loneliness and how to let that be enough.Eddie grapples with his shifting identity and what it means to be unsure of yourself in a world that seems to be so unforgiving.Both men find love in one another and in their diverging lives. And even in the weeks and months to come, as they make their way back to one another, they realize that loving themselves is the only foundation their relationship can rest on.OR: Buck remains in LA with his lingering feelings in this new chapter of his life without Eddie by his side.Eddie is in Texas working on his relationship with Christopher.When you are a parent, you are trying to sell the world to your children.‘Any decent realtor, walking you through a shithole, chirps on about good bones.'And both Buck and Eddie realize that to love the world, they must first love who they are in it.

entry.title: children behave, that’s what they say when we’re together
entry.summary:
Author: Elgney

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 30,618Chapters: 6/6Kudos: 572

Summary: Eddie’s eyes were studying Buck’s face, and whatever he saw there made him say, “there’s no way you can keep this from Maddie.”“No,” Buck folded immediately. “I could try, but . . .”Eddie’s mouth quirked into a smile, showing a dimple, and it was literally heroic of Buck to leave the house with all that going on. “Tell Maddie,” Eddie offered. “Swear her to secrecy. And we’ll just keep it to ourselves until Chris is back on Friday.”He was so smart. His best friend was so smart and also wanted to kiss him and also said they were practically engaged.“Good plan,” said Buck, fighting gravity to continue his way out the door. “It’s just one week. How hard could it be?”---On a very normal Sunday, Buck and Eddie confess their feelings for each other; what follows is a week of the least normal behavior the LAFD has ever seen.

entry.title: The Shift
entry.summary:
Author: LookingforThebooks

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,341Chapters: 1/8Kudos: 1

Summary: Eddie has his “Oh” moment—but he still goes to Texas, hoping distance will make things clearer. Buck, left behind, spirals into Buck 4.0: all charm and distraction, none of it filling the space Eddie left behind.When Eddie returns to LA, they fall into familiar routines—domestic, close, intimate—but nothing’s said. As jealousy flares, Catholic guilt digs deep, and feelings grow too big to ignore, the line between friendship and something more begins to blur.A slowburn about the things they don’t say, and what happens when they finally do.

entry.title: Never Date your Dance Partner
entry.summary:
Author: Averymavery

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,345Chapters: 3/20Kudos: 1

Summary: Eddie Diaz grew up doing ballroom dance. At age 14, he decided not to quit despite wanting nothing more. Now he's 21, halfway through college, and starting over on a new team after getting kicked off his old one. Enter Evan Buckley, his new dance partner's roommate. Maybe Eddie can help Evan heal from his past, and maybe Evan can help Eddie find his love for dance again. Updates random for nowTW for abusive relationships, disordered eating, toxic dance culture

entry.title: the edges of your soul i haven't seen yet
entry.summary:
Author: pumpkinloaf (anybuddiewantsome)

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,556Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 332

Summary: When Eddie met the new ranch hand, Evan Buckley, he was certain their paths would barely cross again.Six years later, they're married and living in Los Angeles with their son, Christopher.The only problem? Nobody knows.OR: Buck and Eddie meet in El Paso, 2012. Uncertainty and fear have kept their relationship secret so far, but when Eddie joins the 118, keeping it is a whole lot harder.

entry.title: It goes like this
entry.summary:
Author: rotisserie_marie_chicken

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,399Chapters: 6/8Kudos: 223

Summary: If the water is at Eddie’s ankles, maybe Buck and Chris are under more water. Because Eddie doesn’t know where the water is coming from or going. He’s so dizzy. His head hurts.“Get him out,” Eddie rasps. “Buck, get him out.”-OR-Eddie doesn’t believe in fate. He just knows he has been following the path laid out for him by religious institutions and cultural obligations since before he could talk.Eddie doesn’t believe in fate. He just isn’t surprised that this is how it ends.

entry.title: fifty states away, but honey i'm thinking of you
entry.summary:
Author: steviebegins

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,196Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 36

Summary: There are a couple of things in which Eddie is for certain:1. Buck’s car makes a singing sound if he goes fast enough.2. Buck drives at ten and two for approximately four and a half minutes before switching his hands.3. The green box sits partially opened in Eddie’s lap, burning a hole through his jeans.Some footnotes for these:1. It's the only sound Eddie wants to hear for the rest of his life as long as Buck is sitting in that driver’s seat with the sun shining and nothing bad has happened to him.2. Buck’s hand rests on the gear shift, and the only thing Eddie wants to do is feel the warmth of his hand in his.3. He wants to take a picture of Buck on this cheap film camera and develop it and stare at it until he’s in a casket. He wants to be buried with it.If Eddie was a stronger man, he would peel his eyes away from Buck and focus on not being in love with his best friend.Unfortunately, Eddie is not that man.He slides the camera out from the box, taking it gently into his hands and turning it over. He switches it on. Point and shoot.Click. ;or a road trip, film camera, and a sleeve of saltines
